instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi, 
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesn't boot.

Some times it shows the Apple logo, and starts to load the progress bar, and them shuts down or reboots. Other times it doesn't do anything (but puls 19.5 V from amp metter).

With the board alone on the bech, connected to an external display, it shows the battery icon and then shuts down.

I don't know where to start. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Try starting in SMC bypass.
Also try safe mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
I've tried both but without success.
When i try to boot in normal or safe mode, it goes to the install menu, and them says the an update is needed, trys to update, but gives an error and all stays the same...
Even when i try to start in recovery mode it does nothing. just stays in the globe logo forever, and no bar, no options, nothing...
Can't do the DFU mode. It doesn't accepet the commands and can't get it to dfu mode

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
No DFU here, isn't T2 machine.

"says the an update is needed"
Did you search the forum for "critical update required"?
Dukefawks has a very good post about it.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/touchbar-critical-software-update-required.58379/[/URL]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
I follow the post but without sucess. Even without the display, the error is the same, and I can't see any  corrosion or knocked off components.
Any other ideas?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Can you post a screenshot of the error message?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Sorry for the delay in the answer, and the screenshot in pt

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: I've tried without the J6200, and no disk found. Withe a different J6200, I get the same error of critical update, and when I install a new macOS, it returns at the same error.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Start in Target Disk mode and do a full test on its SSD from other Mac.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Sorry. How can I do a SSD test from another Mac? Don't know how to do that, and I couldn't find it on the web. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Did you get access of that SSD in Target Disk mode?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Yes, I get, I even installed several times on that SSD, new and different macOS versions on that disk, but after the installation it always returns to the same critical error.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Erase and reformat the SSD, then start Internet Recovery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi again,
Erased and reformatted the SSD,  and Internet Recovery with same result. After the recovery, it goes to the same critical error.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Did you try disconnecting both touch ID and touchbar?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
I've tried now and still the same result. After installation, gets to the same critical error

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: I notice that the hour is always wrong, even when restoring from the web. Does this mean anything relevant for this case? Do you have any idea?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
